intro: Lebetina cooperi, commonly known as the Cooper's lebetina, is a species of flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in wetlands and along the edges of streams, preferring moist, well-drained soil. Lebetina cooperi is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive blooms and relatively low maintenance requirements.
